page.title: 20EDUCATION
page.content: Borehamwood is unusual in having a three-tier system of state schooling. Pupils attend one of nine first schools from 5-9 years, then transfer to a middle school for the years 9-13, and to either{Hillside}or{Nicholas {Hawksmoor}upper school from 13 onwards. Two of the middle schools, {Holmshill}and{Lyndhurst,}collaborated in the Domesday survey of this area while the third,{Furzehill,}worked on an adjacent section. Set remotely in the countryside north of Elstree are the two independent {Haberdashers' Aske's}schools accommodating some 1300 boys and 700 girls as day pupils. Founded in London in 1690, the boys' school moved to the former Aldenham House in 1959, while the girls' school transferred in 1974 to new premises erected on an adjacent site.
